src:
Kemendag Dorong Waralaba Indonesia Tembus Pasar Hongkong
04 Nov 2019, 20:06 by Magdalena


Kemendag Dorong Waralaba Indonesia Tembus Pasar Hongkong

KBRN, Jakarta ; Kementerian Perdagangan berupaya mendorong waralaba lokal untuk merambah pasar dunia. Untuk itu, Menteri Perdagangan melakukan penjajakan kesepakatan bisnis (business matching) yang diikuti 22 pengusaha waralaba lokal dengan 10 pengusaha Hong Kong, yang berlangsung pada 4-5 November 2019 di Kementerian Perdagangan, Jakarta. "Penyelenggaraan kegiatan ini bertujuan mendorong dan menumbuhkembangkan waralaba lokal ke mancanegara," ujar Direktur Jenderal Perdagangan Dalam Negeri Suhanto di Jakarta, Senin ( 04/11/2019).Menurut Suhanto, kegiatan ini digelar mengingat besarnya potensi dan peluang bisnis kuliner Indonesia memasuki pasar Hong Kong. Hal ini dikarenakan jumlah penduduk Hong Kong dan turis yang mengunjungi Hong Kong cukup banyak jumlahnya."Hong Kong adalah mitra dagang Indonesia yang sangat potensial. Nilai perdagangan Indonesia dan Hong Kong tercatat mencapai lebih dari USD 5 miliar pada 2018 dengan tren pertumbuhan positif sebesar 3,2 persen per tahun," jelasnya.Selain kegiatan penjajakan kesepakatan dagang, juga diselenggarakan pameran waralaba di tempat yang sama. Sebanyak 22 peserta turut berpartisipasi dalam pameran tersebut,  di antaranya Black Kebab, Crispyku Fried Chicken, Kebab Turki Baba Rafi, Mushroom Factory, Bebek dan Ayam Goreng Pak Ndut, Warung Koffie Batavia, Coffee Toffee, Ayam Geprek Juara, Bakmi Naga Resto, Quick Chicken, Bangi Coffee, Es Teler 77, Oto Bento, Camcaw, Opera Coffee, Alfamart, Nakamura, Taman Sari Royal Heritage Spa, Tirta Ayu V Spa, Bambu Spa, dan E-MAm Express Coin Laundry. Suhanto menambahkan, melalui kewirausahaan diharapkan dapat menciptakan wirausahawan baru yang mengubah pola pikir masyarakat dari pencari kerja menjadi pencipta lapangan kerja. "Kami juga berharap selama dua hari penyelenggaraan kegiatan ini, para peserta kegiatan mendapatkan mitra dalam negeri dan luar negeri, khususnya pengusaha Hong Kong,” pungkas Suhanto.
text:
The Ministry of Trade Pushes Indonesian Franchise Through the Hong Kong Market
Nov. 04, 2019, 20:06 by Magdalena


The Ministry of Trade Pushes Indonesian Franchise Through the Hong Kong Market

KBRN, Jakarta; The Ministry of Trade seeks to encourage local franchises to penetrate world markets. To that end, the Minister of Trade conducted a business matching agreement which was attended by 22 local franchise entrepreneurs with 10 Hong Kong entrepreneurs, which took place on 4-5 November 2019 at the Ministry of Trade, Jakarta. "The implementation of this activity aims to encourage and grow local franchises to foreign countries," said Director General of Domestic Trade Suhanto in Jakarta, Monday (04/11/2019). Kong This is because the number of Hong Kong residents and tourists visiting Hong Kong is quite large in number. "Hong Kong is a potential trade partner of Indonesia. The value of trade between Indonesia and Hong Kong was recorded to reach more than USD 5 billion in 2018 with a positive growth trend of 3, 2 percent per year, "he explained. In addition to exploring trade agreements, a franchise exhibition was also held at the same place. A total of 22 participants participated in the exhibition, including Black Kebab, Crispyku Fried Chicken, Kebab Turki Baba Rafi, Mushroom Factory, Duck and Fried Chicken Pak Ndut, Warung Koffie Batavia, Coffee Toffee, Geprek Juara Chicken, Bakmi Naga Resto, Quick Chicken , Bangi Coffee, Es Teler 77, Oto Bento, Camcaw, Opera Coffee, Alfamart, Nakamura, Taman Sari Royal Heritage Spa, Tirta Ayu V Spa, Bambu Spa, and E-MAm Express Coin Laundry. Suhanto added, through entrepreneurship it is hoped that new entrepreneurs can change the mindset of the community from job seekers to job creators. "We also hope that during the two days of organizing this event, the participants will get domestic and foreign partners, especially Hong Kong entrepreneurs," concluded Suhanto.
